node.statement: PART II (Hyperbolic regime, fixed q > 0, q ≠ 1 — NEW CONJECTURE): For fixed q > 0, q ≠ 1, melonic dominance breaks down. The quantum 6j symbol {j j j; j j j}_q has exponential large-j asymptotics governed by the volume of the associated hyperbolic tetrahedron: |{6j}_q| ~ exp(j * Vol_hyp(q)) (Taylor-Woodward 2005, Costantino 2007, Belletti-Yang 2025). Non-melonic diagrams grow exponentially rather than being polynomially suppressed. The large-j dynamics is governed by hyperbolic 3D geometry, connecting to the Volume Conjecture (Kashaev 1997, Murakami-Murakami 2001). The model may admit a new solvable limit controlled by the dominant hyperbolic saddle.
